intro: Thlaspi alpestre var. pumilum, commonly known as the Alpine cabbages, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves. It is native to the alpine regions of Europe and is adapted to cold, rocky environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense cluster at the center of the rosette. It is often found in meadows, slopes, and rocky soils at high altitudes. Thlaspi alpestre var. pumilum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh climates and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
